Reviews.Title: “Not even your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: Corinthian1806
Reviews.Content: I was in Sydney for just a few nights for work and I needed to be in the CBD. This was the cheapest hotel i could find. But you really do get what you pay for! The room was small. The extractor fan in the shower was horrific!Sounded like it was going to pull a hole out of the ceiling! The luggage elevator is small and slow. Late at night, a small regiment of the tiniest ants you have ever seen come out to forage! But it is sort of convenient , and the staff do everything with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Glendale L
Reviews.Content: We had an issue with the bookings, but it was quickly rectified with the manager upon check-in. He was very friendly and welcoming. The former boutique hotel was in a convenient location in the city. Just a few minutes walk from the train station and city highlights. The tiny lift for the luggage was quite awkward to load/unload. The room at first glance was cozy but as we stayed there for several nights, we made a list of things that weren't so cozy. It got unbearably stuffy at night. With the window open, the traffic noise kept us awake. Even small things like a curtain that we didn't have to struggle with every night, or a bathroom floor towel/mat would have made our stay a bit more tolerable. The live band/chaos from the bar below surprisingly didn't keep us up like other people have mentioned. Somehow it isolated the noise. But have to say overall, it had an interesting unique charm.

Reviews.Title: “Yay for great staff”
Reviews.Author: Shane M
Reviews.Content: Rooms was simple bit clean. Best part about this was the staff for us as I had accidentally clicked on the incorrect night and had booked the night before instead. Staff were friendly and as they had a spare room were able to accomodate us at no extra charge. We were very excited about this as we had been trekking with luggage on a very muggy day. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: MiMi&Sue
Reviews.Content: Two nights in an executive room midweek. Found the room very small, newly renovated and bed comfortable. Tiny but usable bathroom. Surprised at how quiet it was, but then the function room one floor down was not being used either night. Disappointing was slightly musty smell when I arrived, old and dirty curtains in bathroom, and worn towel with a hole in it. Overall as about the cheapest option I could find for my trip in Sydney those two days not much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: Nswtraveller90
Reviews.Content: It is situated very close to central Sydney,but is over a pub as function room which are open late on weekends and are unbelievably loud.the whole room was vibrating from the music.in the Mornin we were awoken as we could hear the people in the room acros the hall talking loudly due to the walls being so thin and no soundproofing.the pub was fun and the Restaraunt fantastic,but no free parking and the noise mean we won't be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Kirby121
Reviews.Content: Paid $160 for a double executive room... Expecting a room much like the picture. Got a dingy, musky smelling room with stains on the curtains, a shower not worthy of using because you'd come out dirtier than before.. A lovely view outside the window of rusty tin, a bunch of air conditioners and a dirty alley way full of bins. Exposed wood on the door near the lock, looks like it's been kicked in. Bubbling paint on the desk and exposed wires everywhere. Expected MUCH better.. Nobody should ever stay here... Needs to be checked out for health and safety!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: coast2coast255060
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay for the price. It's great value for money where you get a modern clean room in the heart of the city. The staff are very friendly and helpful. For the location there is surprisingly no noise. Everything is clean and fresh and the little extras including the tea, coffee, shampoo soap etc are of quality standard. The italian restaurant is excellent as well but there are plenty of restaurants closeby if you want to venture out. I have stayed here many times and I always recommend it to my friends and work colleauges.

Reviews.Title: “even for the price i would look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: cdn_traveller06
Reviews.Content: Hard a hard time locating the hotel. very poor signage. the hotel is on the upper floors, the elevator was not working when we left, so had to carry the bags down. bed had no frame so box spring was on floor. location is great easy access to harbour. part of the Choice Hotels line.

Reviews.Title: “The live band will keep you up past midnight”
Reviews.Author: norm2012
Reviews.Content: What they don't tell you at this Econo Lodge is that it is one floor above a bar with a live band that plays until at least midnight every night. The band was right below our hotel room. The sound and vibrations were so loud, we could not sleep even with ear plugs. When we complained to management, they told us that the band was supposed to stop at 8:00 p.m. The band never did stop until at least midnight. There is no hotel management onsite in the evening or overnight, so they could not do anything about the band during sleeping hours. If you like loud music in your room that you cannot control until after midnight each night, you may like this!

Reviews.Title: “Thin-Walled, Creaky Old Building on a Loud and Busy Street Corner”
Reviews.Author: lemonbee
Reviews.Content: The online ads look way better than the hotel looks in real life, so don't be fooled like we were into thinking that all hotel rooms in the Econo Lodge South Sydney look like the 4 photos they have online at all the hotel websites. They make the hotel out to be old and charming, but in reality there is no charm, just oldness. We ordered a superior double room, but the room was small and cramped, and you could hear the hallway door slamming everytime someone opened it. The reception desk is right outside rooms #1 and #2, so I feel sorry for people coming out of those rooms and having the receptionists stare at them as they enter and exit their rooms! Talk about lack of privacy! The free breakfast is not some smorgasboard of fruit, bread, pancackes, juice, coffee etc as advertised in outdated sites online... it is a choice of ONE beverage and ONE choice of toast OR *tiny* pancakes, obtained from the cafe across the street! The only good thing about this place is the location: 5 mins walk from the Museum train station, and around the corner from Oxford St. If you are desperate and this is the only hotel you can get, then avoid rooms 1-6, and 21-23, as those rooms overlook Wentworth Ave., which is the noisiest side of the building. Otherwise you will not get any sleep, especially on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: photosheri
Reviews.Content: We got the executive room which was right over a function room with blaring music until 1am then drunks congregating outside our room loudly. Got no sleep all night, were offered only a "sorry, there was a function on" apology. The room wasn't cleaned very well, we found a used empty beer bottle under the chair and my 2 year old found a piece of unwrapped candy on the floor which she of course tried to eat. There was mold in the bathroom, as well as little bugs all over the shower curtain. The lift required a key to operate, but reception is on the second level, so couldn't exactly go up there leaving the pram with my daughter in it to get the key and had to lug the pram up too many flights of stairs. When we got up there, a film crew was filming some sort of ameteur film in the halls and we had to interrupt them every time we left our room or came back. We only booked the hotel so my husband didn't have to get up at some ridiculous hour to get to Hyde Park to run in a half marathon in the morning. Instead, we were up all night and then he had to run half asleep. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything outside your door as if there is only a curtain separating you and them. The doors have a really annoying alarm when you hold down the handle as you open them, pretty much waking everyone in the place whenever someone opens their door. I definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I've stayed at places half the price that were far far better. Also, the window in the bathroom was just below waist level, and opened all the way up, with no screen or bars, a death trap for kids who could easily fall or climb right out (the bathroom door is only a sliding door with no lock, kids can easily open it).

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: GirlOnHolilday
Reviews.Content: The Econo Lodge is a great budget hotel in a good location, just a short walk from George Street and the main shopping centers. The room was nice, (comfortable bed, air con, modern bathroom, high speed internet) and very clean. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, and as I was staying for 2 weeks I got free internet, which is Sydney is a big money saver! The hotel is on the second floor above a pub and a restaurant, I was expecting it to be a lot noisier with the live music below but there were only a few nights when I could even hear anything from downstairs. It wasn't pleasant to have to walk through the pub each day but the hotel upstairs is very different and self contained. Overall I enjoyed my stay, mainly for the location and value in an expensive city like Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs a facelift.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal239
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant when we walked up the three flights of stairs to the reception area: shabby carpet (not to mention managing a ton of stairs with our luggage). The room was small, but had a comforatble bed and the bath was updated. No vent in bath, so some mold on the blinds. Otherwise, the room was clean. The curtains needed replacing. The restaurant seemed to have original Victorian furniture. The young woman at reception sometimes seemed 'put out' by being disturbed with a question, but the man was most helpful. Great location, at a reasonable price, which trumped any complaints. Bar below, while busy, never disturbed us. (Food there average. Staff there great). The building has great 'bones' and it could really do with a facelift to make it a great hotel. Note: there is an elevator, but you have to get them to unlock it for you.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind walking through a crowded bar to access the hotel”
Reviews.Author: judithO
Reviews.Content: I had to walk through a crowded bar to access the hotel which is on the second floor. An antiquated elevator operates by key which means hunting for the person who has the key. My room was not much bigger than a closet. There is no plug near the kettle which meant putting it on the floor to use it. There were extension cords and wiring all over the place and I thought it was quite a fire hazard. The internet wasn't working properly but there was no problem is getting a refund for the time I had purchased. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom sink was tiny and quite old. The Hop on Hop off bus passes by one block away. I had taken the airport express to Museum Station (the nearest one) only to find that there are no escalators or elevators but a lot of steps.

Reviews.Title: “A resonable place in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kraor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is known as the Macquire Inn as well.It is located at the corner of an intersection about 1 1/2 blocks from Central Museum Street Station.It's within walking distance of Chinatown & Daling Harbor.This hotel has small rooms that are recently furbished yet it's in a very old building in which it can show underneath things.They supply basic necessities bathroom soap,toothbrush,toothpaste. The service people are seldom there during the day , when I did deal with them they were less to be desired.The 2 nd floor has a restaurant the first floor has a pub with live music.It's not a bad place to stay if you just want something less expensive to just have a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “I thought this place was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: AJJean
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I showed up on a Saturday night and the pub downstairs was rocking with music and lots of people. Just 2 floors up however it was nice and quiet with a great room, very quaint and clean. The elevator was a bit challenging because it required staff help so I just lugged my bag upstairs. The room was nice, hardwood floors, balcony, and comfy bed. The onsite restaurant was quite good and reasonably priced. The pub and bottle shop downstairs were of good quality and they had a brewery on premises with some house lagers and ciders. The staff was SUPER helpful. The only real inconvenience to me was that they are only there until 8 pm and then there is a duty manager but it wasn't much of a problem. Very close to Hyde Park, restaurants and the train station for easy access to all of the fun things to do in Sydney. I would highly recommend this as a place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Econo Lodge Sydney South
HotelInfo.Address: 40-44 Wentworth Avenue, Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
